TERCIO;Bezerra, Tercio;Bezerra Correia T;TB Correia Terencio;TBC Terencio;T Bezerra;T Bezzerra;TTB Correia;T Tercio;Tercio Bezerra Correia;T, TERENCIO;TERENCIO, TERCIO;T. Terencio

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Iniciou sua carreira como Eletrotcnico CEFET-AL1999 e em seguida se tornou Bacharel em INFORMTICA - ANLISE DE SISTEMAS - ADMINISTRAO pela Fundao Educacional Jayme de Altavila (2003), a mesma reconecida graduao em Informatica - Universit degli Studi di Genova (2003) e doutorou-se em NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY - University of Genoa (2012). Concluindo o pos-doutoroutorado - MIUR - Ministero dell?Istruzione dell?Universit e della Ricerca. , atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: afm, nanotecnologia e instrumentos de alto nvel, nanocomposite, nanogravimetry, smart nanomateriais, nanosensors e nanobiotecnologia. Atualmente faz Pos-Doutorado no Instituto Italiano de Tecnologia - IIT, em um projeto Bi-dipartimental com as sedes em Pontedera e em Genova que envolve seis Universidades, as principais atividades veem desenvolvidas nos departamentos de MicroBioRobotica -MBR (Pontedera) e Neuroscience and Brain Technologies NBT (Genova),
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at INFORMTICA - ANLISE DE SISTEMAS - ADMINISTRAO from Fundao Educacional Jayme de Altavila r (2003) and doctorate and post-doctorate at nanobiotecnology from University of Genoa (2012).bi-departimental Postdoc at Instituto Italiano de Tecnologia - IIT, nos departamentos de MicroBioRobotica -MBR (Pontedera) e Neuroscience and Brain Technologies NBT (Genova),

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Telemar Norte Leste - Rio de Janeiro

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Programa Arte na Escola Alagoas, implantado por edital na UFAL, pelo Instituto Arte na Escola/SP, atravs da PROEX em 2003, rene os professores/as de artes, para discutir questes relativas a melhoria da qualidade do ensino em Alagoas. Organiza cursos, seminrios e grupos de estudos continuados em Artes. A partir desta organizao surgiu a ASPAAL-Associao dos Professores de Arte de Alagoas e a Especializao no Ensino da Arte, atravs da PROPEP. O programa incentivado pelo Instituto Arte na Escola/SP que proporciona o acesso a materiais didtico-pedaggicos (pasta arte br, kits pedaggicos, livros, vdeoteca e DVDteca), alm das informaes encontradas no site www.artenaescola.org.br. O Instituto Arte na Escola valoriza o professor de arte atravs do PRMIO ARTE NA ESCOLA CIDAD, identificando, reconhecendo e divulgando o trabalho pedaggico do professor/a em seus projetos de qualidade no ensino das linguagens artsticas. Acreditamos que a arte deve garantir que os alunos conheam e vivenciem aspectos tcnicos, inventivos, representacionais e expressivos em msica, artes visuais, desenhos, teatro, dana, artes audiovisuais. (FUSARI, p.24, 2001). Para que esta ao acontea, se fazem necessrias polticas pblicas educacionais que fomentem e apoiem o professor/a de artes, nas suas linguagens especificas que so apoiadas por este projeto.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEZERRA CORREIA TERENCIO, TERCIO;Bezzerra, Tercio;Tercio Bezerra;Correia Terencio, Tercio Bezerra;Terencio, Tercio Bezerra Correia;T. TERCIO;Bezerra, Tercio;Bezerra Correia T;TB Correia Terencio;TBC Terencio;T Bezerra;T Bezzerra;TTB Correia;T Tercio;Tercio Bezerra Correia;T, TERENCIO;TERENCIO, TERCIO;T. Terencio

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientficas e tcnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Homogeneous matrices of calcium oxide (CaO) were prepared by mixing this material with polyethylene glycol (PEG) acting as malleable inert support in order to obtain processable composites. Preliminary tests were carried out to assess the best concentration of CaO in the composite, individuated in the CaO/PEG weight ratio of 1/4. Experimental data highlighted that the composite was able to selectively detect carbon dioxide (CO2) via a nanogravimetric method by performing the experiments inside an atmosphere-controlled chamber filled with CO2. Furthermore, the composite material showed a linear absorption of CO2 as a function of the gas concentration inside the atmosphere-controlled chamber, thus paving the way for the possible use of these matrices for applications in the field of sensor devices for long-term evaluation of accumulated environmental CO2.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Matrices for Sensors from Inorganic, Organic, and Biological Nanocomposites
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Matrices for Sensors from Inorganic, Organic, and Biological Nanocomposites

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEZERRA CORREIA TERENCIO, TERCIO;Bezzerra, Tercio;Tercio Bezerra;Correia Terencio, Tercio Bezerra;Terencio, Tercio Bezerra Correia;T. TERCIO;Bezerra, Tercio;Bezerra Correia T;TB Correia Terencio;TBC Terencio;T Bezerra;T Bezzerra;TTB Correia;T Tercio;Tercio Bezerra Correia;T, TERENCIO;TERENCIO, TERCIO;T. Terencio

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Matrices and sensors resulting from inorganic, organic and biological nanocomposites are presented in this overview. The term nanocomposite designates a solid combination of a matrix and of nanodimensional phases differing in properties from the matrix due to dissimilarities in structure and chemistry. The nanoocomposites chosen for a wide variety of health and environment sensors consist of Anodic Porous Allumina and P450scc, Carbon nanotubes and Conductive Polymers, Langmuir Blodgett Films of Lipases, Laccases, Cytochromes and Rhodopsins, Three-dimensional Nanoporous Materials and Nucleic Acid Programmable Protein Arrays.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis and characterization of polyaniline derivatives and related carbon nanotubes nanocomposites Study of optical properties and band gap calculation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Synthesis and characterization of polyaniline derivatives and related carbon nanotubes nanocomposites Study of optical properties and band gap calculation

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientficas e tcnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Poly(o-methylaniline) (POTO), poly(o-methoxyaniline) (POAS), poly(2,5-dimethylaniline) (PDMA), poly(2,5-dimethoxyaniline) (PDOA), and nanocomposite based on multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MWNTs) and single-walled carbon nanotubes (SWNTs) embedded in these conducting polymers, were synthesized by oxidative polymerization. We used the Langmuir?Schaefer (LS) technique to fabricate films at the air?water interface and performed the doping process on the undoped films by dipping the substrates in 1 M hydrochloric acid (HCl) aqueous solution. We recorded UV?vis spectra for both the undoped and doped forms and calculated the related band gaps by using the Tauc equation. Experimental data showed the substituents affected the final oxidation ratio of the polymer chains and the presence of carbon nanotubes (CNTs) in the medium of reaction changed the properties in relation of the kind and number of substituents along the aromatic ring. The study of UV?vis spectra of the undoped nanocomposites and the calculated band gaps highlighted that the conducting polymer chains simply wrapped up around CNTs with no strong interaction. Both the kind and number of substituents along the aromatic rings strongly affected the protonation process, since their capability of ?tuning? the formation of the polaronic state. The presence of CNTs in the polymer matrix showed no appreciable influence in the chemical properties of the doped nanocomposites with respect to the pure conducting polymers.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Nanometrical evaluation of direct laser implant surface
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Nanometrical evaluation of direct laser implant surface

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present study was designed to evaluate the characteristics and the topography of a new implant surface. Titanium discs were manufactured using master alloy powder (Ti-6Al-4V) with a particle size of 25?45mm as the basic material (Leader Implants, Milan, Italy). We acquired images in three different dimensional ranges of decreasing dimensions: 30 (dimensional class A), 10 (dimensional class B), and 5mm2 (dimensional class C). For each dimensional range, we collected five (dimensional classes A and B) to ten (dimensional classes C) different images, belonging both to the center and to the edge of the slide Results ? In dimensional class A, implant surface showed an average roughness value (Ra) of 0.6mm, whereas the root mean square roughness (Rrms) value was 0.78mm. In the dimensional class B, value of Ra was 133.4mm and value of Rrms was 161.7mm. Finally, at a smaller level as in dimensional class C, value of Ra was 68.5mm and Rrms was 81.05mm. Moreover, the peak to peak value was 369.5mm and the average height value was 187.3mm Discussion ? The surface which results from direct laser fabrication process has an ideal nano-roughness to enhance protein adsorption and to facilitate precursor osteoblast adhesion. In conclusion, direct laser forming surface seems to be a promising technique for forming dental implants from titanium alloys. Copyright 2012 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The present study was designed to evaluate the characteristics and the topography of a new implant surface. Titanium discs were manufactured using master alloy powder (Ti-6Al-4V) with a particle size of 25?45mm as the basic material (Leader Implants, Milan, Italy). We acquired images in three different dimensional ranges of decreasing dimensions: 30 (dimensional class A), 10 (dimensional class B), and 5mm2 (dimensional class C). For each dimensional range, we collected five (dimensional classes A and B) to ten (dimensional classes C) different images, belonging both to the center and to the edge of the slide Results ? In dimensional class A, implant surface showed an average roughness value (Ra) of 0.6mm, whereas the root mean square roughness (Rrms) value was 0.78mm. In the dimensional class B, value of Ra was 133.4mm and value of Rrms was 161.7mm. Finally, at a smaller level as in dimensional class C, value of Ra was 68.5mm and Rrms was 81.05mm. Moreover, the peak to peak value was 369.5mm and the average height value was 187.3mm Discussion ? The surface which results from direct laser fabrication process has an ideal nano-roughness to enhance protein adsorption and to facilitate precursor osteoblast adhesion. In conclusion, direct laser forming surface seems to be a promising technique for forming dental implants from titanium alloys. Copyright 2012 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Influence of substituents in electrochemical and conducting properties of polyaniline derivatives and multi walled carbon nanotubes nanocomposites
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Influence of substituents in electrochemical and conducting properties of polyaniline derivatives and multi walled carbon nanotubes nanocomposites

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Poly(o-methoxyaniline) and poly(o-methylaniline) were synthesized by oxidative polymerization in the presence of multi-walled carbon nanotubes (MWNT) for the fabrication of chloroform processable nanocomposites obtained by embedding MWNT in the polymer matrix without the formation of covalent bonds. The study of pressure?area isotherms highlighted different substituents along the aromatic rings affected the packing grade of macromolecules when spreading on different subphases in relation to the associated sterical hindrance. The presence of MWNT inside the polymer matrix showed to favor a more stretched conformation of macromolecules with a subsequent increment of area/molecule values with respect to the corresponding pure conducting polymers. Furthermore, the sterical hindrance affected the nanocomposite electrochemical properties and conducting polymers containing less hindering substituents along the aromatic rings turned out to be faster electrochemical systems. Less hindering substituents were also able to enhance the conducting properties of nanocomposite materials in association with MWNT.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: NAPPA based nanogravimetric biosensor: Preliminary characterization
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: NAPPA based nanogravimetric biosensor: Preliminary characterization

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present our preliminary results about the implementation of a new nanogravimetric biosensor realized combining Quartz Crystal Microbalance with Dissipation Monitoring Nanogravimetry and an innovative protein cell-free expression system named Nucleic Acid Programmable Protein Arrays (NAPPA)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Atomic Force Microscopy and Anodic Porous Allumina of Nucleic Acid Programmable Protein Arrays
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Atomic Force Microscopy and Anodic Porous Allumina of Nucleic Acid Programmable Protein Arrays

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The methodological aspects are here presented for the NAPPA (Nucleic Acid Programmable Protein Arrays) characterization by atomic force microscopy and anodic porous alumina. Anodic Porous Alumina represents also an advanced on chip laboratory for gene expression contained in an engineered plasmid vector. The results obtained with CdK2, CDKN1A, p53 and Jun test genes expressed on NAPPA and the future developments are discussed in terms of our pertinent and recent Patents and of their possibility to overcome some limitations of present fluorescence detection in probing protein-protein interaction in both basic sciences and clinical studies.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The methodological aspects are here presented for the NAPPA (Nucleic Acid Programmable Protein Arrays) characterization by atomic force microscopy and anodic porous alumina. Anodic Porous Alumina represents also an advanced on chip laboratory for gene expression contained in an engineered plasmid vector. The results obtained with CdK2, CDKN1A, p53 and Jun test genes expressed on NAPPA and the future developments are discussed in terms of our pertinent and recent Patents and of their possibility to overcome some limitations of present fluorescence detection in probing protein-protein interaction in both basic sciences and clinical studies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 3D Micropatterned Surface Inspired by via Direct Laser Lithography

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT: Biomimetic functional surfaces are attracting increasing attention for their relevant technological applications. Despite these efforts, inherent limitations of microfabrication techniques prevent the replication of complex hierarchical microstructures. Using a 3D laser lithography technique, we fabricated a 3D patterned surface bioinspired to Salvinia molesta leaves. The artificial hairs, with crownlike heads, were reproduced by scaling down (ca. 100 times smaller) the dimensions of natural features, so that microscale hairs with submicrometric resolution were attained. The micropatterned surface, in analogy with the natural model, shows interesting properties in terms of hydrophobicity and air retention when submerged by water, even if realized with a hydrophilic material. Furthermore, we successfully demonstrated the capability to promote localized condensation of water droplets from moisture in the atmosphere.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: 3D porous polyurethanes featured by different mechanical properties: Characterization and interaction with skeletal muscle cells

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of the Mechanical Behavior of Biomedical Materials

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The fabrication of biomaterials for interaction with muscle cells has attracted significant interest in the last decades. However, 3D porous scaffolds featured by a relatively low stiffness (almost matching the natural muscle one) and highly stable in response to cyclic loadings are not available at present, in this context. This work describes 3D polyurethane-based porous scaffolds featured by different mechanical properties. Biomaterial stiffness was finely tuned by varying the cross-linking degree of the starting foam. Compression tests revealed, for the softest material formulation, stiffness values close to the ones possessed by natural skeletal muscles. The materials were also characterized in terms of local nanoindenting, rheometric properties and longterm stability through cyclic compressions, in a strain range reflecting the contraction extent of natural muscles. Preliminary in vitro tests revealed a preferential adhesion of C2C12 skeletal muscle cells over the softer, rougher and more porous structures. All the material formulations showed low cytotoxicity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Air Trapping Mechanism in Artificial Salvinia-Like Micro-Hairs Fabricated via Direct Laser Lithography
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Air Trapping Mechanism in Artificial Salvinia-Like Micro-Hairs Fabricated via Direct Laser Lithography

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Salvinia leaves represent an extraordinary example of how nature found a strategy for the long term retainment of air, and thus oxygen, on a surface, the so-called ?Salvinia effect?, thanks to the peculiar three-dimensional and hierarchical shape of the hairs covering the leaves. Here, starting from the natural model, we have microfabricated hairs inspired by those present on the Salvinia molesta leaves, by means of direct laser lithography. Artificial hairs, like their natural counterpart, are composed of a stalk and a crown-like head, and have been reproduced in the microscale since this ensures, if using a proper design, an air-retaining behavior even if the bulk structural material is hydrophilic. We have investigated the capability of air retainment inside the heads of the hairs that can last up to 100 h, demonstrating the stability of the phenomenon. For a given dimension of the head, the greater the number of filaments, the greater the amount of air that can be trapped inside the heads since the increase in the number of solid?air interfaces able to pin the liquid phase. For this reason, such type of pattern could be used for the fabrication of surfaces for controlled gas retainment and gas release in liquid phases. The range of applications would be quite large, including industrial, medical, and biological fields.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Anodic Porous Alumina Array for Cyanine Fluorophore Cy3 Confinement

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Materials Science and Nanotechnology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Self-organized anodic porous alumina films with hexagonal pore lattice have attracted a considerable attention for biological arrays and confinement of various organic probes dyes in solutions. A molecular structure with axial symmetry in bis-heterocyclic indole chains and conjugate system, such as cyanine fluorophore Cy3 dye, was investigated here with respect to its fluorescence when loaded in the anodic alumina pores. Cyanine Cy3, stabilized in a buffer phosphate at pH 7.3, was dispersed in milli-Q water by assisted sonication to obtain a resulting concentration of 50 mM. The dark-pink solution was deposited slowly by casting method on the anodic porous alumina surface. Irradiation by mercury lamp at 530 nm wavelength was used to promote the electron transitions to upper discreet orbitals. The photon emission from this excited state was observed as fluorescence in real time from the samples. Atomic force microscopy was used to investigate the topography of anodic porous alumina before the use and it was compared with the CCD camera-microscope images. Frequency histograms showed significant reusable surface after four-cycle rinse steps in a selected surface area.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Nanobiotechnology in Energy, Environment and Electronics: Methods and Applications

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Chapter 2: Innovative Fillers for Dental Resin.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Comparative Effectiveness Research (CER): New Methods, Challenges and Health Implications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Reinforcing fillers have been involved in some of the most important progress in dental resins achieved during the last decade. Many combinations of resins and fillers were tested to date, but overall they did not show remarkable advantages over ?traditional? amalgam. According to this evidence, the field of dental restoration is still open for improvement. A better characterization of new materials ? in terms of both mechanicals and biological properties ? and closer interaction between industry and research centers will likely allow reach those awaited improvements. This chapter will discuss the potential role of fillers in the improvement of the mechanical and biological properties of dental resins.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Chapter 6: Label Free Detection of NAPPA via Atomic Force Microscopy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Chapter 6: Label Free Detection of NAPPA via Atomic Force Microscopy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.ORGANIZADORES: by Claudio Nicolini (University of Genoa, Italy), Joshua LaBaer (Arizona State University, USA)

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientficas e tcnicas

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Cholesterol-LDL Biosensor Based on P450scc-Functionalized Electrodes and Stand-Alone Driver Electronics
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Cholesterol-LDL Biosensor Based on P450scc-Functionalized Electrodes and Stand-Alone Driver Electronics

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: NANOBIONICS IV - from Molecules to Applications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The scope of NanoBionics IV is on functional biological and biorelated molecules and materials and their potentials for technical applications. Their function, preparation, modification, and manipulation as well as their interfacing and integration into technical systems are addressed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Cytochrome P450scc has been used as sensing molecule for the detection of LDL-Cholesterol levels in acqueous solution, as preliminary study for blood analysis. Since the electron transfer response of the biological system is very low in statical conditions (below the normal sensitivity of common electronic equipments), a cyclic voltammetry experiment must be carried out, sweeping the voltage across a range of potential where the oxidation of Cholesterol occurs. The reaction is detected measuring the current during the process. This operation is normally performed by means of controlled potentiostatic/galvanostatic laboratory instruments. To obtain a stand-alone portable device, a triangular wave function generator has been realized using operational amplifiers networks, controlling the period, the amplitude and the offset of the generated wave, while the current is constantly measured and its maximum value is kept as output value. This parameter is recorded by means of a "sample and hold" system. Preliminary results of acqueous solutions of LDL-Cholesterol revealed a sensitivity of 50 uM/cm2.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: NANOTECHNOLOGY AND FUNCTIONAL PROTEOMICS 2nd INTERNATIONAL NWI-HIP FORUM

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This XXII EL.B.A. Nanoforum on Nanotechnogies and Protein Microarrays: Label Free Functional Proteomics, being co-chaired by Professor Claudio Nicolini of Genova University and Professor Joshua LaBaer of Harvard University, results from a periodic scientific seminars sponsored by the Fondazione EL.B.A. in cooperation with CIRSDNNOB-NWI and HIP. Held the first time at Portoconte in July 2007 is now taking place at Genova within the International FIRB Program on Functional Proteomics and Cell Cycle granted to CIRSDNNOB-NWI of Genova University (Italy) and to HIP Harvard University (USA) within the framewotrk of an international cooperation between the Ministry of University and Research (Italy) and Harvard University-Armenise Foundation (USA).

Universidade Federal de Alagoas - Campus Macei

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Programa Arte na Escola Alagoas, implantado por edital na UFAL, pelo Instituto Arte na Escola/SP, atravs da PROEX em 2003, rene os professores/as de artes, para discutir questes relativas a melhoria da qualidade do ensino em Alagoas. Organiza cursos, seminrios e grupos de estudos continuados em Artes. A partir desta organizao surgiu a ASPAAL-Associao dos Professores de Arte de Alagoas e a Especializao no Ensino da Arte, atravs da PROPEP. O programa incentivado pelo Instituto Arte na Escola/SP que proporciona o acesso a materiais didtico-pedaggicos (pasta arte br, kits pedaggicos, livros, vdeoteca e DVDteca), alm das informaes encontradas no site www.artenaescola.org.br. O Instituto Arte na Escola valoriza o professor de arte atravs do PRMIO ARTE NA ESCOLA CIDAD, identificando, reconhecendo e divulgando o trabalho pedaggico do professor/a em seus projetos de qualidade no ensino das linguagens artsticas. Acreditamos que a arte deve garantir que os alunos conheam e vivenciem aspectos tcnicos, inventivos, representacionais e expressivos em msica, artes visuais, desenhos, teatro, dana, artes audiovisuais. (FUSARI, p.24, 2001). Para que esta ao acontea, se fazem necessrias polticas pblicas educacionais que fomentem e apoiem o professor/a de artes, nas suas linguagens especificas que so apoiadas por este projeto.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Morphological investigations on TiO2 nanotubes in dental materials
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Morphological investigations on TiO2 nanotubes in dental materials

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: NAMABIO (Nano and Biomaterials, Stem Cells, Advanced Experimentation and Modelling)
DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: REDEOR (Unified Scientific Approaches towards Regenerative Orthopaedics and Dentistry)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: : Titanium is among the best known elements for dental as well as orthopedic implants. Its metal surface however is hardly compatible with natural environment. Recently, it was suggested that surface anodization could overcame degenerative conditions though the interposition of a thin film buffer layer. However the detailed effects of such oxide layer in connection with its thickness and roughness is still under debate. Specifically, the long term stability of the implant integration and the influence of the presence TiO2 nanotubes on metal surfaces should be deeply characterized. The present work concerns restorative dental materials, specifically polymer resins, which are the most adopted materials in the treatment and prevention of dental pathologies. However, there is still the need of optimizing some of their properties, such as i.e. mechanical strength, surface characteristics and biocompatibility [1]. Moreover, the sylanization process, which is currently used for the preparation of conventional resins, needs to be replaced in order to enhance the mechanical properties and biocompatibility of the materials. Anodized porous alumina (APA) nanoparticles were investigated to improve clinical applications of conventional resins.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Titanium is among the best known elements for dental as well as orthopedic implants. Its metal surface however is hardly compatible with natural environment. Recently, it was suggested that surface anodization could overcame degenerative conditions though the interposition of a thin film buffer layer. However the detailed effects of such oxide layer in connection with its thickness and roughness is still under debate. Specifically, the long term stability of the implant integration and the influence of the presence TiO2 nanotubes on metal surfaces should be deeply characterized. The present work concerns restorative dental materials, specifically polymer resins, which are the most adopted materials in the treatment and prevention of dental pathologies. However, there is still the need of optimizing some of their properties, such as i.e. mechanical strength, surface characteristics and biocompatibility [1]. Moreover, the sylanization process, which is currently used for the preparation of conventional resins, needs to be replaced in order to enhance the mechanical properties and biocompatibility of the materials. Anodized porous alumina (APA) nanoparticles were investigated to improve clinical applications of conventional resins.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.LOCAL-DA-APRESENTACAO: Trinity Conference Center, TRINITY COLLEGE DUBLIN

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: RESINE COMPOSITE PER USO ODONTOIATRICO CARICATE CON DUE DIVERSI FILLER CONFRONTATE TRAMITE ANALISI AL MICROSCOPIO A FORZA ATOMICA (AFM)
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: RESINE COMPOSITE PER USO ODONTOIATRICO CARICATE CON DUE DIVERSI FILLER CONFRONTATE TRAMITE ANALISI AL MICROSCOPIO A FORZA ATOMICA (AFM)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Scopo della ricerca: Osservazione della superficie e valutazione delle propriet applicative di campioni di resina commerciale Tetric EVO Flow (TEF) Ivolclar e di campioni di resina sperimentale Bis-GMA caricata con Allumina Porosa Anodizzata (ER-APA) risultato di innovativi metodi di nanostrutturazione. Metodi: Campioni di TEF e di ER-APA polimerizzati con luce alogena per 30 secondi sono stati osservati al Microscopico a Forza Atomica (AFM). Risultati: Dal confronto delle due superfici la ER-APA presenta evidenti e varie caratteristiche di rugosit.
